result.execSummary:
The defendant James C Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGEMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATION AND/OR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant James C Brown in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Defendant James C Brown in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State places offer on the record.  Defense claims that the State violated the plea agreement.  Discussions held off the record.  Case passed.  Matter recalled.  Same appearances.  Defendant wants to proceed with sentencing.    

Sentencing After Revocation proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, straight time, with credit for 49 days time served.  

Court ordered that all previous sentencing conditions handed down by Judge Skwierawksi on May 21, 2015 to remain.  No further conditions set forth by this Court.
Due to a multitude of issues with having this matter heard today, matter rescheduled to June 2, 2016 at 9:30 a.m. for Sentencing hearing on revocation in Br. 19.
Case spun to Branch 19. Branch 17 in Jury Trial. LNR
Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (22 pages) commencing MAY 21, 2015 received and filed. kl

Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Conformed copy forwarded to all parties

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Chief Judge Office for Processing
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
( x )   Sentence After Revocation

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Complete 24 hours of community service by providing haircuts for children attending MPS schools, and is to be completed within 3 to 4 weeks before September 8, 2015. 
- Complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.   

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant James C Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Brandon A Wigley on behalf of Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Case set for motion hearing. Defense withdrew request for motion hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant James C Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has previously filed motion. For the reasons placed on the record the case is adjourned for Motion Hearing on 5-21-2015 at 1:30 p.m.
Any additional motions to be filed no later than 4-20-2015 by 5:00 p.m., and any additional response to be filed no later than 5-11-2015 by 5:00 p.m.
  Motion hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Defendant James C Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Motion Hearing. Defense motions the Court for an adjournment. State does not object. For the reasons placed on the record the Court grants the Defense motion to adjourn the Motion Hearing. Court orders ase is adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress, received and filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence, received and filed.

Defendant James C Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Brandon A Wigley for Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests case be set for Motion Hearing. Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing in Br. 17.  Any Defense motion is due no later than 03-02-2015 by 5:00 p.m., and any response from the State is due no later than 03-16-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Defendant James C Brown in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Zach Wittchow for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.
